Posted Damian Mandola, founder and owner of Mandola's Italian Kitchen, is celebrating a remarkable milestone‚Äî50 years since he opened his first restaurant at just 21 years old. This June, Mandola will commemorate this golden anniversary with special festivities and delicious offerings. The journey began with Damian's Fine Italian Food, which he launched while a senior in college. Over the decades, Mandola has established 12 restaurant concepts, including the widely recognized Carrabba‚Äôs and Mandola's, which opened in 2006 as an open kitchen, counter-service concept, and Italian market. At Mandola's, guests can experience fresh, scratch-made Italian cuisine made from family recipes. To mark this special year, Mandola's is rolling back the price of its beloved Spaghetti and Meatballs to just $2.25‚Äîthe price it was 50 years ago! This offer will be available to the first 50 guests at each location on June 16, the anniversary date. Join Mandola in celebrating 50 years of dedication to authentic Italian cuisine by visiting their locations in Riverview, Carrollwood, Oldsmar, and Odessa. For more information, visit Mandolas.com .           CEMETERY √ó SEO Page Toggle navigation HOME HOST YOUR EVENT MEMBERSHIP CLUB MEMBERSHIP LADIES AUXILIARY KREWE OF ITALIA NEWSLETTER HISTORY UPCOMING EVENTS CEMETERY CEMETERY CEMETERY SEARCH FESTA ITALIANA ITALIAN INVITATIONAL DONATE CONTACT US CEMETERY The Italian Club Cemetery was established in 1896 following the purchase of land from the Armwood Family, Tampa‚Äôs pioneer African-American family. The first recorded Italian immigrant buried in the cemetery was in 1893. Buried among the members of the Italian Club is Blanche Armwood (1890-1939), a nationally known educator. The Italian Club Cemetery includes a parcel belonging to the Societa de Mutuo Soccorso (Mutual Aid Society). Throughout the cemetery are the imported ceramic photograph markers on the headstones with many inscribed in Sicilian and Italian to pay homage to Sicily, where the stonecutters perfected their craft in granite and marble. A cherished set of rituals governed the Italian funeral. Hundreds of people walked in a cortege, often pausing for a final tribute in front of the deceased‚Äôs house and the Italian Club where flags of Italy and the United States stood at half mast. A brass band led them to the cemetery followed by family and paesani (countrymen). This ritual celebrated the decedent‚Äôs service to the community. In the early years, each club member contributed one dollar to the bereaved family. Later, the club established a $300 survivor benefit. NEW NICHES ARE AVAILABLE! We are pleased to share with you that we recently completed construction on two new Niche Columbariums for cremated remains (see images at below). These two new structures are located inside the existing mausoleum, secured and protected from the elements, and are made of a beautiful white Carrera marble to match the existing mausoleum.  Each niche is specifically labelled with a unique alpha-numeric identifier making it easier for your loved ones to located and pay their respects.  There are over 250 new niches now available for immediate purchase. These are available to the public!  Use the contact us form below for more information or to purchase.  Questions? Call (813) 248-3316 or email mark@italian-club.org Click Here For Full Details On These Niches CEMETERY SEARCH Address and Hours L‚ÄôUnione Italiana Cemetery 2520 E. 24th Avenue Tampa, Florida 33605 Hours: 8am ‚Äì 3pm Daily Contact Us If you are interested in obtaining more information about our cemetery, or if you have questions about purchasing space at the cemetery, please complete the form below, and a member of our staff will contact you soon: * Name Address * Phone * Email Additional Comments Do Not Fill This Out HOST YOUR EVENT HOME HOST YOUR EVENT MEMBERSHIP HISTORY LADIES AUXILIARY KREWE OF ITALIA UPCOMING EVENTS CEMETERY FESTA ITALIANA ITALIAN INVITATIONAL DONATE NEWSLETTER LOCATION: 1731 E. 7TH AVE TAMPA, FL 33605 (813) 248-3316 FOLLOW US ON SOCIAL MEDIA LOCATION: 1731 E. 7TH AVE TAMPA, FL 33605 (813) 248-3316 FOLLOW US ON SOCIAL MEDIA HOME HOST YOUR EVENT MEMBERSHIP HISTORY LADIES AUXILIARY KREWE OF ITALIA UPCOMING EVENTS CEMETERY FESTA ITALIANA ITALIAN INVITATIONAL DONATE NEWSLETTER BOARD OF DIRECTORS CONTACT US COPYRIGHT ¬©

          UPCOMING EVENTS √ó SEO Page Toggle navigation HOME HOST YOUR EVENT MEMBERSHIP CLUB MEMBERSHIP LADIES AUXILIARY KREWE OF ITALIA NEWSLETTER HISTORY UPCOMING EVENTS CEMETERY CEMETERY CEMETERY SEARCH FESTA ITALIANA ITALIAN INVITATIONAL DONATE CONTACT US UPCOMING EVENTS Check out the upcoming events and activities taking place at the Italian Club of Tampa! The events listed below are being hosted by the Italian Club and/or our affiliates. Please click on the flyers to get detailed event information. If you would to purchase tickets to any of our upcoming events, please click the link provided or call the phone number listed on the event. Proceeds from our events benefit the Italian Club Building & Cultural Trust Fund, a registered 501C3 organization (Certificate #:59-2708291) dedicated to the ongoing preservation of our historical facility and the commitment to the Club mission statement. DESTINATION SPAIN! A FOOD & WINE EVENT Friday, September 19th ‚Äì 6pm-8pm GET TICKETS: Get tickets by CLICKING HERE! EVENT DETAILS ‚Äì Prepare to be immersed in the delicious flavors of Spain, as the Italian Club kicks of Hispanic Heritage Month hosting ‚ÄúDestination Spain: A Food & Wine Experience‚Äù. This social event will offer attendees the opportunity to sample over 50 different wines from Spain & Portugal, with the beautiful sounds of Espana filling the room from our special surprise entertainment. Guests will enjoy one of a kind grazing table with assorted meats, cheese, and tapas courtesy of Nibble Nook Catering. To expand the culinary experience, we will be partnering with local caterers and restaurateurs who will provide sample bites celebrating the essence of Spanish and Mediterranean cuisine. As a special experience, Chef Luigi from Trattoria Pasquale will be presenting his famous authentic Spanish Paella, a traditional combination of chicken, chorizo, shrimp, and mussels cooked in a mouthwatering saffron rice. This is a wine buyers event! We will offer exclusive pricing available ONLY at this event for the purchase of wines by the case.  There are two options for attendance ‚Äì a General Admission ($65) ticket or our VIP Tables ($595). Members receive a $10 discount on General Admission Tickets with valid promo code. This event is 21 & over only. Pricing is inclusive of taxes & fees; tickets are only available online; no refunds. Questions? Call (813) 248-3316 or email mark@italian-club.org THIS EVENT IS OPEN TO THE PUBLIC! SWING DANCE NIGHT WITH THE LES ELGART ORCHESTRA & JIMMY DORSEY ORCHESTRA Saturday, September 27th ‚Äì 730pm-11pm GET TICKETS: Get tickets by CLICKING HERE! EVENT DETAILS ‚Äì Join us for a very special evening, as the Italian Club of Tampa welcomes two of the greatest names of the swing era, combining forces to create their finest big band ever!!  The Jimmy Dorsey and Les Elgart Legacy All-Star 18-Piece Orchestra ‚Äì featuring the greatest hits of the ‚ÄúJukebox Kings‚Äù of the 1940‚Äôs and 50‚Äôs.  This remarkable evening will take place on Saturday, September 27th from 730pm-11pm in our large hardwood second-floor, with a nearly 30ft x 40ft dance floor, so our guests can dance the night away!  A full cash/credit bar will be available with specials available all night.  There are two ticket options available, $45 VIP Table Seating (tables seat 10 guests) or $35 General Admission (standing high top tables or chairs around perimeter of the room). Prices includes all taxes and service charges; no refunds are available. Members receive 10% off all tickets. Questions? Call (813) 248-3316 or email mark@italian-club.org THIS EVENT IS OPEN TO THE PUBLIC! FALL 2025 ITALIAN LANGUAGE PROGRAM Classes Start Late-September; Eight (8) Week Course REGISTER TODAY You can enroll in our Italian Language Program by CLICKING HERE! PROGRAM DETAILS ‚Äì Join us as we begin our Fall Session of our expansive Italian Language Program starting in September 2025.  Our Language Instructor, Leona Xharra, with Ciao Bella Gente!, will be offering Level 1, Level 2, Level 3, and Level 4 classes as part of our popular and expanding Italian Language Program. Classes will begin in late-September and continue for an 8-week period ending in mid-November.  Classes will be held in the Italian Club located at 1731 E. 7th Ave in historic Ybor City.  The class fees include in-person instruction, our language textbook, and parking. Enrollment is only available online!  Class sizes are limited to 20 students per class.  Payment is expected at the time of sign up; no refunds.  Class related materials such as books and parking passes will be distributed at the first class. Thank you for your support of the Club and our Italian Language Program! CLASSES ARE OPEN TO THE PUBLIC! FIRST FRIDAY HAPPY HOUR WITH DUELING PIANOS! Friday, October 3rd ‚Äì 5pm-8pm FREE TO ATTEND! No tickets, No reservation! EVENT DETAILS ‚Äì First Fridays at the Italian Club is a new concept in happy hour nightlife, combining delicious food and great drinks with fun live entertainment, making for a fun, casual night out with friends and family! Home of the Buy-One-Get-One Italian Wine deal!  Our Club Cantina will be transformed into a fun, social dueling piano bar ‚Äì with incredible live music and more. We will be serving up a delicious homemade Italian meal for just $20 courtesy of our friends at Trattoria Pasquale! All our meals include our signature house salad and famous garlic breadsticks. The entree will change each month. Dinner availability is limited, so come early!   Questions? Call (813) 248-3316 or email mark@italian-club.org THIS EVENT IS OPEN TO THE PUBLIC! ORCHESTRA FUEGO LIVE! LATIN MUSIC NIGHT Saturday, October 4th ‚Äì 8pm-12am GENERAL TICKETS: Get tickets by CLICKING HERE! VIP TICKETS: Get tickets by CLICKING HERE! EVENT DETAILS ‚Äì Tampa, are you ready? The Italian Club Tampa proudly presents an unforgettable night of salsa, sabor, and swing as the internationally acclaimed Orchestra Fuego sets Ybor City ablaze on Saturday, October 4th, 2025 ‚Äî and you won‚Äôt want to miss a single beat! Grab your dance shoes and your best moves! We‚Äôre powering through the evening with high energy hits from our brand new album ‚ÄúMambo Mania‚Äù alongside all your Fuego favorites. From blistering Mambo grooves to soulful Salsa melodies, we‚Äôre serving the full Fuego experience.  PLUS ‚Äì the incredible Vaya DJ will be spinning the hottest Latin beats before, between, and after our sets, keeping the floor ignited with Salsa, Bachata, Merengue, and more all night long.  Come early, enjoy the Italian Club‚Äôs classic ambiance and full bar, then dance the night away with one of the world‚Äôs top independent Salsa bands and Tampa‚Äôs own Latin vibes master, Vaya DJ!  Orchestra Fuego is bringing the HEAT to Tampa ‚Äî let‚Äôs make this a night to remember!  Questions? Call (813) 248-3316 or email mark@italian-club.org THIS EVENT IS OPEN TO THE PUBLIC! BREAKROOM ENTERTAINMENT PRESENTS: HOLLYWOOD PARODIES ON ICE Saturday, October 10th or October 11th ‚Äì Show at 8pm GET TICKETS: Get tickets by CLICKING HERE! EVENT DETAILS ‚Äì Following the success of TikTok sensation Disney Parodies On Ice and Broadway Parodies On Ice (14 million views and counting!), the Breakroom gang returns to lampoon your favorite songs from the movies!  Featuring fan-favorite theme tunes to films like Titanic, 9 to 5, Grease, Jurassic Park, The Greatest Showman, Ghostbusters, and many more, this one-of-a-kind, cabaret-style comedy concert performance is sure to be a crowd pleaser!  Two show options ‚Äì Friday, October 10 (8pm) OR Saturday, October 11 (8pm).  Doors open 30 minutes before showtime. Cabaret-style table seating is open, first-come, first served. No refunds. THIS PERFORMANCE CONTAINS ADULT LANGUAGE AND MAY NOT BE SUITABLE FOR CHILDREN UNDER 13.  PLEASE NOTE: THIS IS NOT AN ACTUAL ICE-SKATING SHOW.  Questions? Email pedro@breakroomtampa.com THIS EVENT IS OPEN TO THE PUBLIC! PRESIDENTS CUP BOCCE TOURNAMENT FUNDRAISER Sunday October 12th ‚Äì 11am-4pm GET TICKETS: Get tickets by CLICKING HERE! EVENT DETAILS ‚Äì The Italian Club of Tampa will host its first ever Presidents Cup Bocce Tournament Fundraiser on Sunday, October 12th from 11am-4pm as part of our larger Bocce Bowl Weekend! Players and guests will enjoy a delicious buffet, and a full cash/credit bar with signature cocktails all day! This will be a social event with great music adding to the atmosphere, with friends, family, and spectators welcome! We have secured an exclusive VIP location in Ybor City, teaming up with local businesses and donors to make this one of the Clubs premier Bocce Events! Complimentary parking on site! BOCCE TEAM REGISTRATION ‚Äì Team registration is $300/team which includes one four-person team, two drink tickets per player, complimentary food from Frankies Italian Deli, music, and more! Limited to the first 20 teams! GUESTS & SPECTATORS WELCOME ‚Äì This is going to be a fun, social event and we encourage participation from members, friends, families to support to this inaugural event. Guest tickets are $35pp and include a delicious buffet from Frankies Italian Deli! Questions? Call (813) 248-3316 or email mark@italian-club.org THIS EVENT IS OPEN TO THE PUBLIC! SICILIAN TENORS LIVE! AN ITALIAN HERITAGE MONTH CELEBRATION Saturday, October 25th ‚Äì 6pm-10pm GET TICKETS: Get tickets by CLICKING HERE! EVENT DETAILS ‚Äì Join us as we welcome the legendary Sicilian Tenors for a one night only evening celebrating Italian Heritage Month and the rich culture and history of our organization. The evening will include a gala cocktail reception in our historic 2nd Floor Theater, once home to Tampa‚Äôs own Norma Tina Russo, who performed and taught opera in our building. This will be a ‚Äútaste of Italy in Tampa‚Äù style cocktail reception, with sample portions from some of Tampa‚Äôs best restaurants, and passed hors d‚Äôoeuvres along side the beautiful sounds of local high school orchestra. Attendees will enjoy an an open bar with featured Italian wines and signature cocktails. Guests will then move to our 3rd Floor Grand Ballroom for the performance, with VIP Cabaret Seating available (front two rows) and General Admission Seating (Theater Style behind). Business and/or Cocktail attire is requested.  WANT TO JOIN US? We offer two ticket options for guests. Our VIP Tickets are $95 each, and will include front row cabaret seating for the performance, and a private meet and greet with the tenors. Our General Admission Tickets are $85, and will include mid-room theater style seating accommodations. Prices are inclusive of tax and service charges. Tickets are only available online; no refunds. Members contact the office for 10% discount promo code on genera admission tickets. Questions? Call (813) 248-3316 or mark@italian-club.org THIS EVENT IS OPEN TO THE PUBLIC! FIRST FRIDAY HAPPY HOUR WITH DUELING PIANOS! Friday, November 7th ‚Äì 5pm-8pm FREE TO ATTEND! No tickets, No reservation! EVENT DETAILS ‚Äì First Fridays at the Italian Club is a new concept in happy hour nightlife, combining delicious food and great drinks with fun live entertainment, making for a fun, casual night out with friends and family! Home of the Buy-One-Get-One Italian Wine deal!  Our Club Cantina will be transformed into a fun, social dueling piano bar ‚Äì with incredible live music and more. We will be serving up a delicious homemade Italian meal for just $20 courtesy of our friends at Trattoria Pasquale! All our meals include our signature house salad and famous garlic breadsticks. The entree will change each month. Dinner availability is limited, so come early!   Questions? Call (813) 248-3316 or email mark@italian-club.org THIS EVENT IS OPEN TO THE PUBLIC! SAVE THE DATE: A SINATRA CLASSIC CHRISTMAS ‚Äì TWO NIGHTS! Thursday December 4th & Friday December 5th 2025 EVENT DETAILS ‚Äì Join us as we welcome RICK MICHEL and his 7-piece big band orchestra for an evening celebrating the holiday season! Rick Michel, who has performed and headlined in Las Vegas since 1981, will present ‚ÄúA Sinatra Classic Christmas‚Äù, a show focusing on the classic music of Frank Sinatra, Dean Martin, Sammy Davis Jr., Bing Crosby, and many more! Michel salutes and interprets ‚ÄúOl‚Äô Blue Eyes‚Äù standards. Michel has been called ‚Äúthe closest thing to Sinatra we have ever heard‚Äù by ‚ÄúVariety.‚Äù  This is not a Frank Sinatra impersonation show, but rather an evening to celebrating the classic holiday favorites sung by some of the greatest artists of our time.  Tables seat 8 guests, and a cash/credit bar will be available.  THESE SHOWS WILL SELL OUT!  We anticipate tickets going on sale in during the upcoming summer 2025, so please mark your calendars for this incredible night of live music.  More details on this event coming soon!  Questions? Call (813) 248-3316 or email mark@italian-club.org THIS EVENT IS OPEN TO THE PUBLIC! Claim Profile Overview Gallery 0 About The Italian Club of Tampa Our ancient, three-story structure was built more than a century ago and is a work of art in terms of architecture. This wonderfully restored, classically exquisite structure, which is well situated in the Ybor City historic neighborhood, offers the ideal location for someone looking for an all-in-one facility. We provide three unique rooms, each with their own personality and aesthetic. The Cantina, Theater, and Grand Ballroom are located on the first, second, and third floors, respectively, of the three-story structure. The Italian Club has the distinct appeal of being able to handle a wedding ceremony, cocktail hour, and reception in three different settings, each with a nurtured charm of their own, thanks to its three floors of event space.

Please fill out the form on our site if you are interested in having an event at the Club or would like more details about our space. A staff member will get in touch with you as soon as possible. IDEx director shares archaeological discoveries from ancient Sicily at the Italian Club of Tampa Skip to Main Content University of South Florida College of Arts & Sciences Search Search for: Main Navigation Menu Give Now About Departments Research Undergrad Graduate Alumni and Friends MyUSF Directory CAS Chronicles Breadcrumb Navigation College of Arts & Sciences CAS Chronicles 2024 IDEx director shares archaeological discoveries from ancient Sicily at the Italian
               Club of Tampa Dr. Davide Tanasi present ed his research on ancient Sicily at The Italian Club of Tampa, located in historic
                           Ybor City. (Photo courtesy of Dr. Davide Tanasi) IDEx director shares archaeological discoveries from ancient Sicily at the Italian
               Club of Tampa Elisa Hussain, USF College of Arts and Sciences April 19, 2024 Events , Research A postcard of The Italian Club building, circa 1910s. (Photo by Hampton Dunn Collection
                     of Florida Postcards, USF Digital Commons) Dr. Davide Tanasi , a professor in the Department of History and the director of the College of Arts and Sciences‚Äô Institute of Digital Exploration (IDEx), presented a three-part lecture series on his research into ancient Sicily
                  at The Italian Club of Tampa located in Ybor City. The sold-out event sought to reinvigorate the cultural legacy
                  of the club while fostering connections between the Italian American community and
                  USF. The Italian Club of Tampa was established to provide a space where Italian Americans
                  could unite to navigate the social and economic challenges during the turn of the
                  century. Today, its iconic building in Ybor City remains a hub for this community
                  and others in the Tampa Bay area. Tanasi specializes in the archaeology of ancient Sicily, utilizing cutting-edge scientific
                  approaches like remote sensing and biomolecular chemistry to study material culture.
                  During the lecture series, he shared his research in three key areas: the monumental
                  legacy of Greek and Roman Sicily, the spectacle and entertainment in Roman Sicily,
                  focusing on gladiatorial games, and the culinary traditions of Roman Sicily. Initially motivated to organize the lecture series to energize the cultural offerings
                  at the Italian Club, Tanasi also aimed to educate the Italian American community about
                  their rich Sicilian heritage. ‚ÄúSince the vast majority of the Italian Americans in Tampa have Sicilian ancestry,
                  it became a great opportunity for me to build a bridge between them and the fascinating
                  ancient history of the island. Considering that I have active research projects in
                  Sicily and that USF students routinely join me for fieldwork, I thought that it would
                  be beneficial for the community to know what USF does to highlight the history of
                  Sicily and train students in becoming future experts in the field,‚Äù Tanasi said. All three segments of the event were fully booked, drawing large audiences. This strong
                  turnout provided valuable insights for Tanasi, highlighting a desire for this community
                  to learn more about their heritage. ‚ÄúThe lectures were incredibly well attended, with 250 people in attendance at each
                  event. This proves first, that there is great interest and desire by this community
                  to know more about Sicily and its charming history. Secondly, the powerful 3D visuals
                  that I use in my presentations combined with my storytelling skills made the events
                  informative and entertaining. Lastly, the popularization of science, in this case
                  archaeology, is very attractive, as proven by the great success of certain historical
                  fiction and shows available on streaming services or at movie theaters,‚Äù Tanasi said. This lecture series acted as a catalyst for bringing crucial research to a broader
                  audience. Tanasi hopes that these events will help spread information that's typically
                  not accessible to those outside the research field. He aims to foster connections
                  and bridge gaps across different disciplines. ‚ÄúArchaeology complements history as a sister discipline, filling in gaps that historical
                  writings may not have mentioned. While history focuses on main characters and major
                  events, archaeology studies the lives of ordinary men and women and the minor events
                  of their lives. For example, one of the focal points of my project, the Greek city
                  of Heloros, is barely mentioned in the ancient sources practically making it non-existent
                  in history. But, after three years of work on that site, we uncovered a blossoming
                  city sprawling over 15 acres with splendid temples, public buildings, massive fortification
                  walls, and even a theater!‚Äù Tanasi explained. Attendees observe Dr. Davide Tanasi during the three-part lecture series hosted at
                     The Italian Club of Tampa. (Photo courtesy of Dr. Davide Tanasi) Tanasi is currently the lead for IDEx‚Äôs two significant projects in remote sensing
                  and digital archaeology: the Heloros Advanced Digital Exploration and Surveying , and the Archaeological Heritage in Late Antique and Byzantine Sicily focusing on digital archaeology at the UNESCO World Heritage site of the Roman Villa
                  of Casale in Piazza Armerina. Alongside his research endeavors, he is also the co-program director for the Spring
                  Break Study Abroad Program, USF Sicily: History and Culture , offering students the chance to explore the social, political, and cultural dimensions
                  of ancient Greece and Rome. Reflecting on the success of this lecture series, Tanasi was invited again by the
                  Italian Club to deliver another three-part lecture series this upcoming Fall. He hopes
                  to explore other aspects of Sicilian archaeology and unveil the secrets of this historic
                  region. To learn more about Dr. Davide Tanasi‚Äôs work, visit the Institute of Digital Exploration . Sullivan, President Chris T. Sullivan founded Outback Steakhouse in 1988 with Bob Basham Tim Gannon, and Trudy Cooper and served as former Chairman and CEO of Outback Steakhouse, Inc. The company went public in 1991 and over the next 15 years Sullivan collaborated with the founders of Carrabba‚Äôs Italian Grill, Bonefish Grill, Fleming‚Äôs Prime Steakhouse and Roy‚Äôs Hawaiian Fusion to develop and operate over 1400 restaurants worldwide.  In 2007, with then CEO Bill Allen, the OSI Board of Directors and executive team, the company was sold to Bain Capital Partners, Catterton Partners and the Founders.  In 2012, the reconstructed company, Bloomin‚Äô Brands, Inc. went public and Sullivan serves as a Director. He is currently a partner of MVP Holdings, Inc. which include Lee Roy Selmon‚Äôs Restaurants, Carmel Kitchen and Wine Bar, MenuPad, LLC, Chairman; ConSul Partners, LLC and numerous restaurant industry investments. Mr. Sullivan is a graduate of the University of Kentucky, with a B.S. degree in Business and Economics, and in 2000 he was inducted into the Hall of Distinguished Alumni. In 1997, Sullivan together with Bob Basham and Bob Merritt, founded Old Memorial Golf Club. Currently, Mr. Sullivan serves on the Executive Committee and Board of Directors of the Horatio Alger Association of Distinguished Americans and is active in numerous charitable organizations focusing on catastrophic diseases, PTSD and education. Alex Sullivan Alex Sullivan, Vice President Alex Sullivan is director of real estate for Metro Diner, a restaurant company out of Tampa, FL. He has led the real estate department as Metro Diner grew from 5 locations to over 70.  He is also a managing member of Shamrock Private Trust Company where he handles family office duties for the Sullivan family. Mr. Sullivan‚Äôs history started with WCI Communities as a member of their management training program from 2003-2004.  In 2004, Mr. Sullivan was a founding member of A&S Properties of Florida which was a home acquisition and refurbishing company.  While still operating A&S Properties in 2005, he founded Palmcrest Properties of Florida, a company specializing on land acquisition and entitlement.  In 2006, Mr. Sullivan became a partner in Palmcrest Homes, a residential real estate company.  In 2009, Mr. Sullivan left real estate to become a partner in Caf√© Caturra in Richmond, VA.  He then became a founder and executive vice president of Carmel Caf√© & Wine Bar. Mr. Sullivan is a graduate of College of Charleston with a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration.  He is also chairman of the board from National Pediatric Cancer Foundation, board member of Academy Prep of Tampa and a board member of the Chris T Sullivan Foundation. Aside from being a leader in the restaurant industry, Mr. Sullivan enjoys being a member of Old Memorial Golf Club, Palma Ceia Golf and Club and Ye Mystic Krewe of Gasparilla. Being philanthropic is also a big part of who he is as an individual. He is highly involved in the community and serves on the Board of Pediatric Cancer Foundation, is Chairman of Fashion for the Cure and serves on the Development Committee at Academy Prep.
